fields.value: Replication data for: A Bayesian Change Point Model for Historical Time Series Analysis

dsDescriptionValue.value: Political relationships often vary over time, but standard models ignore temporal variation in regression relationships. We describe a Bayesian model that treats the change point in a time series as a parameter to be estimated. In this model, inference for the regression coefficients reflects prior uncertainty about the location of the change point. Inferences about regression coefficients, unconditional on the change-point location, can be obtained by simulation methods. The model is illustrated in an analysis of real wage growth in 18 OECD countries from 1965â€“1992.

publicationCitation.value: Bruce Western and Meredith Kleykamp. 2004. "A Bayesian Change Point Model for Historical Time Series Analysis." Political Analysis, 12(4), 354-374. subscribe to Political Analysis to access the full article

files.description: An R script that implements Gibbs sampler and SSCP functions in a small example with artifical data.
files.label: bcp1.R

dataFile.description: An R script that implements Gibbs sampler and SSCP functions in a small example with artifical data.

files.description: An R script containing functions for the Gibbs sampler and SSCP methods for Bayesian estimation of a change point model. This file is called by bcp1.R
files.label: bcp.R

dataFile.description: An R script containing functions for the Gibbs sampler and SSCP methods for Bayesian estimation of a change point model. This file is called by bcp1.R

files.description: A WinBUGS file containing two Bayesian change point models: (1) one with constant error variance, and (2) one with nonconstant error variance across countries.
files.label: cp00.bug

dataFile.description: A WinBUGS file containing two Bayesian change point models: (1) one with constant error variance, and (2) one with nonconstant error variance across countries.

files.description: A data file containing S-Plus style lists of initial values to be used for each of the models in cp00.bug. Two sets of initial values are provided for each model, yielding two chains that are run in parallel.
files.label: inits0.dat

dataFile.description: A data file containing S-Plus style lists of initial values to be used for each of the models in cp00.bug. Two sets of initial values are provided for each model, yielding two chains that are run in parallel.

files.description: A data file containing S-Plus style lists to be read by each of the models in cp00.bug.
files.label: oecd0.dat

dataFile.description: A data file containing S-Plus style lists to be read by each of the models in cp00.bug.
